title: Barry Humphries' flashbacks [DVD]
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Popular culture
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Television
abstract: Episode 1 The 50s 24 hours of sunshine:--Episode 2 The 60s Does anyone still wear a hat?:--Episode 3 The 70s On the map at last:--Episode 4 The 80s The Party of a lifetime
description: Entertainer and self confessed cultural historian Barry Humphries takes the viewer on a voyage of discovery into Australian society in the 1950s, 60s, 70s and 80s. Relive choice moments from the following decades such as; Menzies, music through the ages, Petrov, Queen Elizabeth, Coronation, soapies' sophistication, decimal currency, Aussie inventions, television, the 1956 Olympic Games, republicanism, quizshows, Beatniks, Australian images overseas, advertising, the Melbourne Cup, charm schools, rock stars, immigration, demolition, the Sydney Opera House, Harold Holt, pubs, police, contraception, American servicemen, Alvin Purple, "Number 96", the Logies, plus many other memorable moments. Humphries is assisted in this discovery by some special friends; Dame Edna Everage, Sandy Stone, and Sir Les Patterson. Also available on VHS [309408]
